intro: Schizoloma heterophyllum, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. Its small, white or pinkish flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Schizoloma heterophyllum is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or coastal habitats.
